title: Hilary Duff enjoys a rock climbing workout with her boyfriend Matthew Koma
text:
They've been dating since 2015.

But Hilary Duff showed she still knows how to keep the spark alive with fiancé Matthew Koma.

The Younger actress, 32, enjoyed a rock climbing date night with her other half on Thursday.

Active: Hilary Duff showed she still knows how to keep the spark alive with fiancé Matthew Koma as she shared a video of herself climbing a rock wall and having a blast on a 'date night,' according to her caption

Hilary took to Instagram to share scenes from their fun-filled night in a video she captioned, 'Date night got crazy last night!'

In the video she wears a black beanie, a white t-shirt and black leggings and turns around to smile at the camera, presumably manned by Koma.

Visible beneath her beanie are the strands that she lightened recently in honor of the upcoming Lizzie McGuire reboot.

Her hairstylist, Nikki Lee, took to Instagram to share a photo of the results.

Way up: In the video she wears a black beanie, a white t-shirt and black leggings and turns around to smile at the camera, presumably manned by Koma

'Never in a million years did I think I would be doing Lizzie’s color!' she wrote in the caption.

'Well dreams do come true! Thank you @hilaryduff for trusting me to create the perfect blonde for the next chapter of Lizzie Mcguire!'

In the new Lizzie McGuire series, Duff will play an older and wiser version of her character from the early-2000s Disney Channel show.

Lizzie will return to the small-screen as a 30-year-old who works as an apprentice to an NYC decorator.

New look: Visible beneath her beanie are the strands that she lightened recently in honor of the upcoming Lizzie McGuire reboot

After the show was announced, Duff told People that she felt it was the 'right' time for the show to come back, since the stages of life that Lizzie and target audiences would be in coincide with one another.

'The conversations have gone on for a couple of years and the timing just didn’t seem right and now Lizzie is turning 30,' she said.

'For me, she was everybody’s best friend and she was there for us… entering your 30s is a really big deal.'

'I think it’s the right time to set back in and have her go along with you in your 30s and all the fun times, and all of the big monumental moments, and all of the challenges that you’re faced with,' she said.

Cute: Later that day, Duff shared a photo of herself and 11-month old daughter Banks in the middle of play, Banks doing a handstand on Duff's lap

'I just thought that there was an opportunity there for her to be grown up and for her to be there for women again.'

Later that day, Duff shared a photo of herself and 11-month old daughter Banks in the middle of play, Banks doing a handstand on Duff's lap.

'Me and my girl starting this weekend early by getting cozzzzzzy! What are you doing??' she captioned the photo.

Duff also shares seven-year-old Luca with ex Mike Comrie.
